SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

cellularAutomata
Class CAConstants

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.CAConstants

public class CAConstants
extends java.lang.Object

Constants used by the CA. (Some are not true constants, but instead are loaded from a property file called ca_constants.txt.) If the constants file does not exist, then default values are used.

Author:
David Bahr

Field Detail

COMPATIBLE_JAVA_VERSION

public static final int COMPATIBLE_JAVA_VERSION
The Cellular Automaton Explorer needs this version of Java or a later version. This must be an integer number, and represents the first number in the official java version. For example, the 1 in 1.5.3, or the 2 in 2.0.1.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

COMPATIBLE_JAVA_RELEASE

public static final int COMPATIBLE_JAVA_RELEASE
The Cellular Automaton Explorer needs this release of Java or a later release. This must be an integer number, and represents the second number in the official java version. For example, the 5 in 1.5.3, or the 0 in 2.0.1, or the 12 in 2.12.7.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final java.lang.String CA_FILE_EXTENSION

Constant Field Values

LATTICE_CENTRIC_CHOICES

public static boolean LATTICE_CENTRIC_CHOICES
Will be true if the lattice is selected and then rules are "greyed out". Should stay false unless a menu item is added to let the user select rules after the lattice.

LINUX_OS

public static boolean LINUX_OS
Will be true if this is a linux operating system and false otherwise.

MAC_OS

public static boolean MAC_OS
Will be true if this is any Mac operating system and false otherwise.

MAC_OS_X

public static boolean MAC_OS_X
Will be true if this is specifically a Mac OS X operating system and false otherwise (true only for OS X and not other Mac operating systems).

WINDOWS_OS

public static boolean WINDOWS_OS
Will be true if this is *any* windows operating system and false otherwise.

WINDOWS_XP_OS

public static boolean WINDOWS_XP_OS
Will be true if this is a window XP operating system and false otherwise.
